marklogic.body:
My wife called the ambulance for me on 02Jan2012 because I was throwing up and passing out. I have had a history of angina, Chest pains, and other cardiac-related problems. She thought I might be experiencing a stroke and called the ambulance. They came and took me to Huntsville Hospital (Alabama). Fortunately, I was only having a severe migraine - that was the official diagnosis - and they sent me home.
The bill came for the ambulance...just under $700.00 because they sent an Advanced Life Support (ALS) team - reasonable under the circumstances. My insurance (Tricare Prime...I am a retired Navy Chief Petty Officer) is refusing to pay the charge because they say I didn't need ALS for a migraine Headache. I am guessing that my wife should have known I wasn't having a stroke??? I certainly couldn't tell her because I was Vomiting and passing out.
Now the ambulance company (HEMSI) is ready to send it to collections; I have been on the phone to tricare and the ambulance company several times. I cannot get either side to budge or to help me get this Resolved.
